alert.note: Alert for Clark (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 10:14AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Warren, Henderson, McDonough, Hancock, southwestern Des Moines, eastern Lee and southeastern Clark Counties through 1100 AM CDT... At 1013 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Denmark to 6 miles northeast of Canton. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... West Burlington, Dallas City, Middletown and Iowa Army Ammunition Plant around 1020 AM CDT. Burlington, Carman and Gulf Port around 1025 AM CDT. West Point around 1030 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Stronghurst, Terre Haute, Bowen, Augusta, Raritan, Roseville and Little Swan Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 AM CDT for southeastern Iowa...and northeastern Missouri.
